title: Helium-3 Reactor Test
body: The Helium-3 prototype reactor aboard Olympus Base achieved sustained ignition. Power output exceeded projections by 12%. Thermal shielding and core plasma stability remained within expected tolerances during the full 8-hour test cycle, confirming readiness for scaled deployment in Phase 2.

title: Elevator Stability Test
body: Tether oscillation tests for the Phobos orbital elevator passed Phase 3 parameters. Deployment planned for Q4. Wind shear damping and auto-tensioning systems showed improved performance under simulated micrometeorite impact conditions, reducing vibration amplitude by 34%.

title: Rover Discovers Ice Vein
body: Autonomous Rover ARGO mapped a subglacial ice deposit under Elysium Planitia. Estimated reserves: 18,000 mÂ³. Ground-penetrating radar and spectroscopic analysis confirm purity levels suitable for electrolysis-based life support and fuel synthesis applications.
